Tool reply2025-11-29T21:56:24.006Z
     1â†’import { useEffect, useState } from 'react'
     2â†’import { useRouter } from 'next/router'
     3â†’import Head from 'next/head'
     4â†’import { requestService, communityService } from '@/lib/api'
     5â†’import Layout from '@/components/Layout'
     6â†’import InlineChat from '@/components/InlineChat'
     7â†’
     8â†’interface HelpRequest {
     9â†’  id: string
    10â†’  title: string
    11â†’  description: string
    12â†’  status: string
    13â†’  urgency: string
    14â†’  category: string
    15â†’  community_id: string
    16â†’  community_name: string
    17â†’  requester_id: string
    18â†’  requester_name?: string
    19â†’  created_at: string
    20â†’}
    21â†’
    22â†’interface Match {
    23â†’  id: string
    24â†’  request_id: string
    25â†’  responder_id: string
    26â†’  status: string
    27â†’  created_at: string
    28â†’  responder_name?: string
    29â†’  requester_name?: string
    30â†’  request_description?: string
    31â†’}
    32â†’
    33â†’interface Community {
    34â†’  id: string
    35â†’  name: string
    36â†’}
    37â†’
    38â†’export default function Dashboard() {
    39â†’  const router = useRouter()
    40â†’  const [user, setUser] = useState<any>(null)
    41â†’  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
    42â†’
    43â†’  // Quick create state
    44â†’  const [description, setDescription] = useState('')
    45â†’  const [postingMode, setPostingMode] = useState<'all' | 'specific'>('all')
    46â†’  const [selectedCommunity, setSelectedCommunity] = useState<string>('')
    47â†’  const [userCommunities, setUserCommunities] = useState<Community[]>([])
    48â†’  const [creating, setCreating] = useState(false)
    49â†’
    50â†’  // Unified feed
    51â†’  const [feedItems, setFeedItems] = useState<any[]>([])
    52â†’  const [expandedPosts, setExpandedPosts] = useState<Set<string>>(new Set())
    53â†’
    54â†’  useEffect(() => {
    55â†’    const token = localStorage.getItem('token')
    56â†’    const userData = localStorage.getItem('user')
    57â†’
    58â†’    if (!token) {
    59â†’      router.push('/login')
    60â†’      return
    61â†’    }
    62â†’
    63â†’    if (userData) {
    64â†’      const parsedUser = JSON.parse(userData)
    65â†’      setUser(parsedUser)
    66â†’      fetchDashboardData(parsedUser.id)
    67â†’    }
    68â†’  }, [router])
    69â†’
    70â†’  const fetchDashboardData = async (userId: string) => {
    71â†’    try {
    72â†’      setLoading(true)
    73â†’
    74â†’      // Fetch all data in parallel
    75â†’      const [myRequestsRes, allMatchesRes, suggestedRes, communitiesRes] = await Promise.all([
    76â†’        requestService.getRequests({ limit: 50 }),
    77â†’        requestService.getMatches({ limit: 100 }),
    78â†’        requestService.getRequests({ status: 'open', limit: 50 }),
    79â†’        communityService.getCommunities(),
    80â†’      ])
    81â†’
    82â†’      const allRequests = myRequestsRes.data.data
    83â†’      const allMatches = allMatchesRes.data.data
    84â†’      const suggestedRequests = suggestedRes.data.data
    85â†’
    86â†’      // Combine all requests (my requests + community requests) for lookup
    87â†’      const allRequestsCombined = [...allRequests, ...suggestedRequests]
    88â†’
    89â†’      // Build unified feed with post-and-comment structure
    90â†’      // Priority order: matched requests â†’ accepted offers â†’ community requests â†’ global posts
    91â†’      const feed: any[] = []
    92â†’
    93â†’      // No more deduplication needed! Backend now creates ONE request per logical post
    94â†’      // (linked to multiple communities via junction table)
    95â†’
    96â†’      // PRIORITY 1: My Requests with Matched/Accepted Offers (Amber - Highest Priority)
    97â†’      const myRequestsMatched = allRequests.filter(
    98â†’        (r: HelpRequest) =>
    99â†’          r.requester_id === userId &&
   100â†’          allMatches.some((m: Match) => m.request_id === r.id && m.status === 'matched')
   101â†’      )
   102â†’
   103â†’      myRequestsMatched.forEach((request) => {
   104â†’        const matches = allMatches.filter((m: Match) => m.request_id === request.id)
   105â†’        feed.push({
   106â†’          type: 'post',
   107â†’          priority: 1,
   108â†’          post: request,
   109â†’          comments: matches, // All offers/matches are "comments"
   110â†’          isMyPost: true,
   111â†’          hasAcceptedOffer: matches.some((m: Match) => m.status === 'matched'),
   112â†’          timestamp: request.created_at,
   113â†’        })
   114â†’      })
   115â†’
   116â†’      // PRIORITY 2: My Accepted Offers (Blue - I'm helping, they accepted)
   117â†’      const myAcceptedOffers = allMatches.filter(
   118â†’        (m: Match) => m.responder_id === userId && m.status === 'matched'
   119â†’      )
   120â†’
   121â†’      // Get the unique requests for these offers
   122â†’      const acceptedOfferRequestIds = new Set(myAcceptedOffers.map((m: Match) => m.request_id))
   123â†’      const acceptedOfferRequests = allRequestsCombined.filter((r: HelpRequest) => acceptedOfferRequestIds.has(r.id))
   124â†’
   125â†’      acceptedOfferRequests.forEach((request) => {
   126â†’        const myMatch = allMatches.find(
   127â†’          (m: Match) => m.request_id === request.id && m.responder_id === userId && m.status === 'matched'
   128â†’        )
   129â†’        if (myMatch) {
   130â†’          feed.push({
   131â†’            type: 'post',
   132â†’            priority: 2,
   133â†’            post: request,
   134â†’            comments: [myMatch], // Only show my thread with the poster
   135â†’            isMyPost: false,
   136â†’            isMyOffer: true,
   137â†’            myMatch,
   138â†’            timestamp: myMatch.created_at, // Sort by when I offered
   139â†’          })
   140â†’        }
   141â†’      })
   142â†’
   143â†’      // PRIORITY 3: My Requests with Pending Offers (Amber)
   144â†’      const myRequestsPending = allRequests.filter(
   145â†’        (r: HelpRequest) =>
   146â†’          r.requester_id === userId &&
   147â†’          r.status === 'open' &&
   148â†’          !allMatches.some((m: Match) => m.request_id === r.id && m.status === 'matched')
   149â†’      )
   150â†’
   151â†’      myRequestsPending.forEach((request) => {
   152â†’        const matches = allMatches.filter((m: Match) => m.request_id === request.id)
   153â†’        feed.push({
   154â†’          type: 'post',
   155â†’          priority: 3,
   156â†’          post: request,
   157â†’          comments: matches,
   158â†’          isMyPost: true,
   159â†’          hasAcceptedOffer: false,
   160â†’          timestamp: request.created_at,
   161â†’        })
   162â†’      })
   163â†’
   164â†’      // PRIORITY 4: My Pending Offers (Blue - waiting for response)
   165â†’      const myPendingOffers = allMatches.filter(
   166â†’        (m: Match) => m.responder_id === userId && m.status === 'proposed'
   167â†’      )
   168â†’
   169â†’      const pendingOfferRequestIds = new Set(myPendingOffers.map((m: Match) => m.request_id))
   170â†’      const pendingOfferRequests = allRequestsCombined.filter((r: HelpRequest) => pendingOfferRequestIds.has(r.id))
   171â†’
   172â†’      pendingOfferRequests.forEach((request) => {
   173â†’        const myMatch = allMatches.find(
   174â†’          (m: Match) => m.request_id === request.id && m.responder_id === userId && m.status === 'proposed'
   175â†’        )
   176â†’        if (myMatch) {
   177â†’          feed.push({
   178â†’            type: 'post',
   179â†’            priority: 4,
   180â†’            post: request,
   181â†’            comments: [myMatch], // Only my thread
   182â†’            isMyPost: false,
   183â†’            isMyOffer: true,
   184â†’            myMatch,
   185â†’            timestamp: myMatch.created_at,
   186â†’          })
   187â†’        }
   188â†’      })
   189â†’
   190â†’      // PRIORITY 5: Community Requests (White - from my communities, not responded)
   191â†’      const respondedRequestIds = new Set(
   192â†’        allMatches.filter((m: Match) => m.responder_id === userId).map((m: Match) => m.request_id)
   193â†’      )
   194â†’
   195â†’      const communityReqs = suggestedRequests.filter(
   196â†’        (r: HelpRequest) => r.requester_id !== userId && !respondedRequestIds.has(r.id)
   197â†’      )
   198â†’
   199â†’      communityReqs.forEach((request) => {
   200â†’        feed.push({
   201â†’          type: 'post',
   202â†’          priority: 5,
   203â†’          post: request,
   204â†’          comments: [], // No comments visible (not my post, haven't offered)
   205â†’          isMyPost: false,
   206â†’          isMyOffer: false,
   207â†’          timestamp: request.created_at,
   208â†’        })
   209â†’      })
   210â†’
   211â†’      // Sort by priority first, then by timestamp within each priority
   212â†’      feed.sort((a, b) => {
   213â†’        if (a.priority !== b.priority) {
   214â†’          return a.priority - b.priority // Lower priority number = higher importance
   215â†’        }
   216â†’        return new Date(b.timestamp).getTime() - new Date(a.timestamp).getTime()
   217â†’      })
   218â†’
   219â†’      setFeedItems(feed)
   220â†’      setUserCommunities(communitiesRes.data.data)
   221â†’    } catch (err) {
   222â†’      console.error('Failed to load dashboard data:', err)
   223â†’    } finally {
   224â†’      setLoading(false)
   225â†’    }
   226â†’  }
   227â†’
   228â†’  const handleCreateRequest = async () => {
   229â†’    if (!description.trim()) return
   230â†’
   231â†’    try {
   232â†’      setCreating(true)
   233â†’      await requestService.createRequest({
   234â†’        post_to_all_communities: postingMode === 'all',
   235â†’        community_id: postingMode === 'specific' ? selectedCommunity : undefined,
   236â†’        description: description.trim(),
   237â†’        type: 'general',
   238â†’        urgency: 'medium',
   239â†’      })
   240â†’
   241â†’      // Clear form and refresh
   242â†’      setDescription('')
   243â†’      setPostingMode('all')
   244â†’      setSelectedCommunity('')
   245â†’      if (user) {
   246â†’        await fetchDashboardData(user.id)
   247â†’      }
   248â†’    } catch (error: any) {
   249â†’      console.error('Error creating request:', error)
   250â†’      alert(error.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to create request')
   251â†’    } finally {
   252â†’      setCreating(false)
   253â†’    }
   254â†’  }
   255â†’
   256â†’  const handleOfferToHelp = async (requestId: string) => {
   257â†’    if (!user) return
   258â†’
   259â†’    try {
   260â†’      await requestService.createMatch({
   261â†’        request_id: requestId,
   262â†’        responder_id: user.id,
   263â†’      })
   264â†’
   265â†’      // Refresh data to show as "YOUR OFFER" - no popup needed
   266â†’      await fetchDashboardData(user.id)
   267â†’    } catch (error: any) {
   268â†’      console.error('Error offering to help:', error)
   269â†’      // Only show alert on error
   270â†’      alert(error.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to offer help')
   271â†’    }
   272â†’  }
   273â†’
   274â†’  const handleAcceptMatch = async (matchId: string) => {
   275â†’    if (!user) return
   276â†’
   277â†’    try {
   278â†’      await requestService.acceptMatch(matchId, user.id)
   279â†’      // Refresh data to show updated status
   280â†’      await fetchDashboardData(user.id)
   281â†’    } catch (error: any) {
   282â†’      console.error('Error accepting match:', error)
   283â†’      alert(error.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to accept offer')
   284â†’    }
   285â†’  }
   286â†’
   287â†’  const handleRejectMatch = async (matchId: string) => {
   288â†’    if (!user) return
   289â†’
   290â†’    try {
   291â†’      await requestService.rejectMatch(matchId, user.id)
   292â†’      // Refresh data
   293â†’      await fetchDashboardData(user.id)
   294â†’    } catch (error: any) {
   295â†’      console.error('Error rejecting match:', error)
   296â†’      alert(error.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to reject offer')
   297â†’    }
   298â†’  }
   299â†’
   300â†’  const handleCompleteMatch = async (matchId: string) => {
   301â†’    if (!user) return
   302â†’
   303â†’    try {
   304â†’      await requestService.completeMatch(matchId, user.id)
   305â†’      // Refresh data to show completed status
   306â†’      await fetchDashboardData(user.id)
   307â†’    } catch (error: any) {
   308â†’      console.error('Error completing match:', error)
   309â†’      alert(error.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to mark complete')
   310â†’    }
   311â†’  }
   312â†’
   313â†’  const formatTime = (timestamp: string) => {
   314â†’    const date = new Date(timestamp)
   315â†’    const now = new Date()
   316â†’    const diffMs = now.getTime() - date.getTime()
   317â†’    const diffMins = Math.floor(diffMs / 60000)
   318â†’    const diffHours = Math.floor(diffMs / 3600000)
   319â†’    const diffDays = Math.floor(diffMs / 86400000)
   320â†’
   321â†’    if (diffMins < 1) return 'just now'
   322â†’    if (diffMins < 60) return `${diffMins}m ago`
   323â†’    if (diffHours < 24) return `${diffHours}h ago`
   324â†’    if (diffDays === 1) return 'yesterday'
   325â†’    if (diffDays < 7) return `${diffDays}d ago`
   326â†’    return date.toLocaleDateString('en-US', { month: 'short', day: 'numeric' })
   327â†’  }
   328â†’
   329â†’  if (!user || loading) {
   330â†’    return (
   331â†’      <div className="min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center">
   332â†’        <div className="text-center">
   333â†’          <div className="animate-spin rounded-full h-12 w-12 border-b-2 border-blue-600 mx-auto"></div>
   334â†’          <p className="text-gray-600 mt-4">Loading your dashboard...</p>
   335â†’        </div>
   336â†’      </div>
   337â†’    )
   338â†’  }
   339â†’
   340â†’  return (
   341â†’    <>
   342â†’      <Head>
   343â†’        <title>Dashboard - Karmyq</title>
   344â†’      </Head>
   345â†’      <Layout>
   346â†’        <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-50">
   347â†’          <div className="container mx-auto px-4 py-6 max-w-4xl">
   348â†’            {/* Quick Create */}
   349â†’            <div className="bg-white rounded-xl shadow-sm p-6 mb-6 border border-gray-200">
   350â†’              <div className="flex items-start gap-4">
   351â†’                <div className="w-10 h-10 bg-gradient-to-br from-blue-500 to-purple-600 rounded-full flex items-center justify-center text-white font-semibold flex-shrink-0">
   352â†’                  {user.name?.charAt(0).toUpperCase()}
   353â†’                </div>
   354â†’                <div className="flex-1">
   355â†’                  <textarea
   356â†’                    value={description}
   357â†’                    onChange={(e) => setDescription(e.target.value)}
   358â†’                    placeholder="What do you need help with?"
   359â†’                    className="w-full px-4 py-3 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 focus:border-transparent resize-none"
   360â†’                    rows={3}
   361â†’                  />
   362â†’                  <div className="flex items-center justify-between mt-3">
   363â†’                    <div className="flex items-center gap-3">
   364â†’                      <button
   365â†’                        onClick={() => setPostingMode('all')}
   366â†’                        className={`px-4 py-2 rounded-lg text-sm font-medium transition-colors ${
   367â†’                          postingMode === 'all'
   368â†’                            ? 'bg-blue-100 text-blue-700'
   369â†’                            : 'bg-gray-100 text-gray-700 hover:bg-gray-200'
   370â†’                        }`}
   371â†’                      >
   372â†’                        All My Communities
   373â†’                      </button>
   374â†’                      <button
   375â†’                        onClick={() => setPostingMode('specific')}
   376â†’                        className={`px-4 py-2 rounded-lg text-sm font-medium transition-colors ${
   377â†’                          postingMode === 'specific'
   378â†’                            ? 'bg-blue-100 text-blue-700'
   379â†’                            : 'bg-gray-100 text-gray-700 hover:bg-gray-200'
   380â†’                        }`}
   381â†’                      >
   382â†’                        Specific Community
   383â†’                      </button>
   384â†’                    </div>
   385â†’                    <button
   386â†’                      onClick={handleCreateRequest}
   387â†’                      disabled={!description.trim() || creating}
   388â†’                      className="px-6 py-2 bg-blue-600 text-white rounded-lg font-medium hover:bg-blue-700 disabled:opacity-50 disabled:cursor-not-allowed transition-colors"
   389â†’                    >
   390â†’                      {creating ? 'Posting...' : 'Post'}
   391â†’                    </button>
   392â†’                  </div>
   393â†’                  {postingMode === 'specific' && (
   394â†’                    <div className="mt-3">
   395â†’                      <select
   396â†’                        value={selectedCommunity}
   397â†’                        onChange={(e) => setSelectedCommunity(e.target.value)}
   398â†’                        className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 focus:border-transparent"
   399â†’                      >
   400â†’                        <option value="">Select a community...</option>
   401â†’                        {userCommunities.map((community) => (
   402â†’                          <option key={community.id} value={community.id}>
   403â†’                            {community.name}
   404â†’                          </option>
   405â†’                        ))}
   406â†’                      </select>
   407â†’                    </div>
   408â†’                  )}
   409â†’                </div>
   410â†’              </div>
   411â†’            </div>
   412â†’
   413â†’            {/* Unified Post Feed */}
   414â†’            <div>
   415â†’              <h2 className="text-xl font-bold text-gray-900 mb-4 px-1">Your Feed</h2>
   416â†’              {feedItems.length === 0 ? (
   417â†’                <div className="bg-white rounded-xl p-12 text-center border border-gray-200">
   418â†’                  <div className="text-5xl mb-4">ğŸ¤</div>
   419â†’                  <h3 className="text-xl font-semibold text-gray-700 mb-2">No activity yet</h3>
   420â†’                  <p className="text-gray-500">
   421â†’                    Create a request above or check back later to see community requests
   422â†’                  </p>
   423â†’                </div>
   424â†’              ) : (
   425â†’                <div className="space-y-4">
   426â†’                  {feedItems.map((item, index) => {
   427â†’                    const { post, comments, isMyPost, isMyOffer, hasAcceptedOffer, myMatch, priority } = item
   428â†’
   429â†’                    // Determine post styling based on type
   430â†’                    let bgColor = 'bg-white'
   431â†’                    let borderColor = 'border-gray-200'
   432â†’                    let badgeColor = 'bg-gray-100 text-gray-700'
   433â†’                    let badgeText = ''
   434â†’
   435â†’                    if (isMyPost && hasAcceptedOffer) {
   436â†’                      bgColor = 'bg-amber-50'
   437â†’                      borderColor = 'border-l-4 border-amber-400'
   438â†’                      badgeColor = 'bg-amber-100 text-amber-700'
   439â†’                      badgeText = 'âœ“ YOUR REQUEST - MATCHED'
   440â†’                    } else if (isMyPost) {
   441â†’                      bgColor = 'bg-amber-50'
   442â†’                      borderColor = 'border-l-4 border-amber-400'
   443â†’                      badgeColor = 'bg-amber-100 text-amber-700'
   444â†’                      badgeText = 'YOUR REQUEST'
   445â†’                    } else if (isMyOffer && myMatch?.status === 'matched') {
   446â†’                      bgColor = 'bg-blue-50'
   447â†’                      borderColor = 'border-l-4 border-blue-400'
   448â†’                      badgeColor = 'bg-blue-100 text-blue-700'
   449â†’                      badgeText = 'âœ“ YOU\'RE HELPING'
   450â†’                    } else if (isMyOffer && myMatch?.status === 'proposed') {
   451â†’                      bgColor = 'bg-blue-50'
   452â†’                      borderColor = 'border-l-4 border-blue-400'
   453â†’                      badgeColor = 'bg-blue-100 text-blue-700'
   454â†’                      badgeText = 'YOUR OFFER'
   455â†’                    }
   456â†’
   457â†’                    return (
   458â†’                      <div
   459â†’                        key={`post-${post.id}-${index}`}
   460â†’                        className={`${bgColor} ${borderColor} rounded-lg shadow-sm overflow-hidden hover:shadow-md transition-shadow`}
   461â†’                      >
   462â†’                        <div className="p-6">
   463â†’                          {/* Post Header */}
   464â†’                          <div className="flex items-start justify-between mb-3">
   465â†’                            <div className="flex items-center gap-3 flex-1">
   466â†’                              <div className="w-10 h-10 bg-gradient-to-br from-blue-500 to-purple-600 rounded-full flex items-center justify-center text-white font-semibold flex-shrink-0">
   467â†’                                {post.requester_name?.charAt(0).toUpperCase() || '?'}
   468â†’                              </div>
   469â†’                              <div className="flex-1">
   470â†’                                <p className="font-medium text-gray-900">{post.requester_name || 'Unknown'}</p>
   471â†’                                <p className="text-sm text-gray-500">{formatTime(post.created_at)}</p>
   472â†’                              </div>
   473â†’                            </div>
   474â†’                            {badgeText && (
   475â†’                              <span className={`text-xs font-medium px-2 py-1 rounded ${badgeColor}`}>{badgeText}</span>
   476â†’                            )}
   477â†’                          </div>
   478â†’
   479â†’                          {/* Post Content */}
   480â†’                          <p className="text-gray-900 text-base leading-relaxed mb-3">{post.description}</p>
   481â†’
   482â†’                          {/* Post Meta */}
   483â†’                          <div className="flex items-center gap-4 text-sm text-gray-600 mb-3">
   484â†’                            <span className="flex items-center gap-1">
   485â†’                              <svg className="w-4 h-4" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24">
   486â†’                                <path
   487â†’                                  strokeLinecap="round"
   488â†’                                  strokeLinejoin="round"
   489â†’                                  strokeWidth={2}
   490â†’                                  d="M17 20h5v-2a3 3 0 00-5.356-1.857M17 20H7m10 0v-2c0-.656-.126-1.283-.356-1.857M7 20H2v-2a3 3 0 015.356-1.857M7 20v-2c0-.656.126-1.283.356-1.857m0 0a5.002 5.002 0 019.288 0M15 7a3 3 0 11-6 0 3 3 0 016 0zm6 3a2 2 0 11-4 0 2 2 0 014 0zM7 10a2 2 0 11-4 0 2 2 0 014 0z"
   491â†’                                />
   492â†’                              </svg>
   493â†’                              {post.community_name}
   494â†’                            </span>
   495â†’                            {comments.length > 0 && isMyPost && (
   496â†’                              <span className="text-gray-700 font-medium">
   497â†’                                ğŸ’¬ {comments.length} {comments.length === 1 ? 'offer' : 'offers'}
   498â†’                              </span>
   499â†’                            )}
   500â†’                          </div>
   501â†’
   502â†’                          {/* Action Button - Only for community requests */}
   503â†’                          {!isMyPost && !isMyOffer && (
   504â†’                            <button
   505â†’                              onClick={() => handleOfferToHelp(post.id)}
   506â†’                              className="w-full px-4 py-2.5 bg-blue-600 text-white rounded-lg font-medium hover:bg-blue-700 transition-colors"
   507â†’                            >
   508â†’                              ğŸ’¬ Offer to Help
   509â†’                            </button>
   510â†’                          )}
   511â†’
   512â†’                          {/* Comments Section - Offers/Responses */}
   513â†’                          {comments.length > 0 && (() => {
   514â†’                            // Sort comments: accepted first, then by created_at
   515â†’                            const sortedComments = [...comments].sort((a, b) => {
   516â†’                              // Accepted (matched) come first
   517â†’                              if (a.status === 'matched' && b.status !== 'matched') return -1
   518â†’                              if (a.status !== 'matched' && b.status === 'matched') return 1
   519â†’                              // Otherwise sort by creation time (newest first)
   520â†’                              return new Date(b.created_at).getTime() - new Date(a.created_at).getTime()
   521â†’                            })
   522â†’
   523â†’                            // Show top 3 comments by default, or all if expanded
   524â†’                            const isExpanded = expandedPosts.has(post.id)
   525â†’                            const visibleComments = isExpanded ? sortedComments : sortedComments.slice(0, 3)
   526â†’                            const hasMore = sortedComments.length > 3
   527â†’
   528â†’                            return (
   529â†’                            <div className="mt-4 pt-4 border-t border-gray-200">
   530â†’                              <h3 className="text-sm font-semibold text-gray-900 mb-3">
   531â†’                                {isMyPost ? `Responses (${comments.length})` : 'Your Conversation'}
   532â†’                              </h3>
   533â†’                              <div className="space-y-3">
   534â†’                                {visibleComments.map((comment: Match) => (
   535â†’                                  <div key={comment.id} className="bg-white rounded-lg p-4 border border-gray-200">
   536â†’                                    <div className="flex items-start justify-between mb-3">
   537â†’                                      <div className="flex items-center gap-3">
   538â†’                                        <div className="w-8 h-8 bg-gradient-to-br from-green-500 to-teal-600 rounded-full flex items-center justify-center text-white text-sm font-semibold">
   539â†’                                          {comment.responder_name?.charAt(0).toUpperCase() || '?'}
   540â†’                                        </div>
   541â†’                                        <div>
   542â†’                                          <p className="font-medium text-gray-900">{comment.responder_name || 'Unknown'}</p>
   543â†’                                          <p className="text-xs text-gray-500">offered {formatTime(comment.created_at)}</p>
   544â†’                                        </div>
   545â†’                                      </div>
   546â†’                                      {/* Action buttons for poster */}
   547â†’                                      {isMyPost && comment.status === 'proposed' && (
   548â†’                                        <div className="flex gap-2">
   549â†’                                          <button
   550â†’                                            onClick={() => handleAcceptMatch(comment.id)}
   551â†’                                            className="px-3 py-1 bg-green-600 text-white text-sm rounded-lg hover:bg-green-700 transition-colors font-medium"
   552â†’                                          >
   553â†’                                            Accept
   554â†’                                          </button>
   555â†’                                          <button
   556â†’                                            onClick={() => handleRejectMatch(comment.id)}
   557â†’                                            className="px-3 py-1 bg-gray-200 text-gray-700 text-sm rounded-lg hover:bg-gray-300 transition-colors font-medium"
   558â†’                                          >
   559â†’                                            Decline
   560â†’                                          </button>
   561â†’                                        </div>
   562â†’                                      )}
   563â†’                                      {/* Status badges */}
   564â†’                                      {comment.status === 'matched' && (
   565â†’                                        <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
   566â†’                                          <span className="px-2 py-1 bg-green-100 text-green-700 text-xs rounded-lg font-medium">
   567â†’                                            âœ“ Accepted
   568â†’                                          </span>
   569â†’                                          <button
   570â†’                                            onClick={() => handleCompleteMatch(comment.id)}
   571â†’                                            className="px-3 py-1 bg-blue-600 text-white text-xs rounded-lg hover:bg-blue-700 transition-colors font-medium"
   572â†’                                          >
   573â†’                                            Mark Complete
   574â†’                                          </button>
   575â†’                                        </div>
   576â†’                                      )}
   577â†’                                      {comment.status === 'completed' && (
   578â†’                                        <span className="px-2 py-1 bg-purple-100 text-purple-700 text-xs rounded-lg font-medium">
   579â†’                                          âœ“ Completed
   580â†’                                        </span>
   581â†’                                      )}
   582â†’                                    </div>
   583â†’
   584â†’                                    {/* Inline Chat */}
   585â†’                                    {(comment.status === 'proposed' || comment.status === 'matched') && (
   586â†’                                      <InlineChat
   587â†’                                        matchId={comment.id}
   588â†’                                        currentUserId={user.id}
   589â†’                                        isRequester={isMyPost}
   590â†’                                        matchStatus={comment.status}
   591â†’                                        otherParticipantName={comment.responder_name || 'Unknown'}
   592â†’                                      />
   593â†’                                    )}
   594â†’                                  </div>
   595â†’                                ))}
   596â†’
   597â†’                                {/* Show More/Less Button */}
   598â†’                                {hasMore && (
   599â†’                                  <button
   600â†’                                    onClick={() => {
   601â†’                                      const newExpanded = new Set(expandedPosts)
   602â†’                                      if (isExpanded) {
   603â†’                                        newExpanded.delete(post.id)
   604â†’                                      } else {
   605â†’                                        newExpanded.add(post.id)
   606â†’                                      }

   608â†’                                    }}
   609â†’                                    className="w-full py-2 text-sm text-blue-600 hover:text-blue-700 font-medium transition-colors"

   614â†’                                    }
   615â†’                                  </button>
   616â†’                                )}
   617â†’                              </div>
   618â†’                            </div>
   619â†’                            )
   620â†’                          })()}
   621â†’                        </div>
   622â†’                      </div>
   623â†’                    )
   624â†’                  })}
   625â†’                </div>

Great! I found the issues:

  1. Duplicate Requests: Deborah has TWO separate request records (f700e224... and 830b0d37...) both with the same description. This is creating duplicates in the feed.

  2. Request Status Issue: The match shows matched but I need to check if the request status was properly updated.

   131â†’        success: false,
   132â†’        message: 'request_id and responder_id are required',
   133â†’      });

   135â†’
   136â†’    // Verify request exists and is open
   137â†’    const requestCheck = await query(
   138â†’      `SELECT id, status, requester_id FROM requests.help_requests WHERE id = $1`,
   139â†’      [request_id]
   140â†’    );
   141â†’
   142â†’    if (requestCheck.rowCount === 0) {
   143â†’      return res.status(404).json({
   144â†’        success: false,
   145â†’        message: 'Request not found',
   146â†’      });
   147â†’    }
   148â†’
   149â†’    if (requestCheck.rows[0].status !== 'open') {
   150â†’      return res.status(400).json({
   151â†’        success: false,
   152â†’        message: 'Request is not open',
   153â†’      });
   154â†’    }
   155â†’

   162â†’      );
   163â†’

   165â†’        return res.status(404).json({
   166â†’          success: false,
   167â†’          message: 'Offer not found',
   168â†’        });
   169â†’      }
   170â†’
   171â†’      if (offerCheck.rows[0].status !== 'active') {
   172â†’        return res.status(400).json({
   173â†’          success: false,
   174â†’          message: 'Offer is not active',
   175â†’        });
   176â†’      }

   179â†’      if (offerCheck.rows[0].offerer_id !== responder_id) {

   232â†’
   233â†’// PUT /matches/:id/accept - Accept a proposed match
   234â†’router.put('/:id/accept', async (req: Request, res: Response) => {
   235â†’  try {
   236â†’    const { id } = req.params;
   237â†’    const { user_id } = req.body;
   238â†’
   239â†’    // Get match details
   240â†’    const matchCheck = await query(
   241â†’      `SELECT
   242â†’        m.id, m.request_id, m.offer_id, m.responder_id, m.status,
   243â†’        r.requester_id
   244â†’      FROM requests.matches m
   245â†’      LEFT JOIN requests.help_requests r ON m.request_id = r.id
   246â†’      WHERE m.id = $1`,
   247â†’      [id]
   248â†’    );
   249â†’
   250â†’    if (matchCheck.rowCount === 0) {
   251â†’      return res.status(404).json({
   252â†’        success: false,
   253â†’        message: 'Match not found',
   254â†’      });
   255â†’    }
   256â†’
   257â†’    const match = matchCheck.rows[0];
   258â†’
   259â†’    // Verify user is the requester
   260â†’    if (match.requester_id !== user_id) {
   261â†’      return res.status(403).json({
   262â†’        success: false,
   263â†’        message: 'Only the requester can accept this match',
   264â†’      });
   265â†’    }
   266â†’
   267â†’    // Verify match is in proposed state
   268â†’    if (match.status !== 'proposed') {
   269â†’      return res.status(400).json({
   270â†’        success: false,
   271â†’        message: 'Match must be in proposed state to accept',
   272â†’      });
   273â†’    }
   274â†’
   275â†’    // Accept match
   276â†’    await query(
   277â†’      `UPDATE requests.matches
   278â†’       SET status = 'matched'
   279â†’       WHERE id = $1`,
   280â†’      [id]
   281â†’    );
   282â†’
   283â†’    // Update request status to matched
   284â†’    await query(
   285â†’      `UPDATE requests.help_requests
   286â†’       SET status = 'matched'
   287â†’       WHERE id = $1`,
   288â†’      [match.request_id]
   289â†’    );
   290â†’
   291â†’    // Reject all other proposed matches for this request
   292â†’    await query(
   293â†’      `UPDATE requests.matches
   294â†’       SET status = 'rejected'
   295â†’       WHERE request_id = $1 AND id != $2 AND status = 'proposed'`,
   296â†’      [match.request_id, id]
   297â†’    );
   298â†’
   299â†’    // Publish event

<system-reminder>

Assistant2025-11-29T21:57:24.545Z

Found it! The problem is:

  1. Duplicate Requests: Deborah has TWO request records with the same description:
  2. f700e224... - has a matched status AND a match with Amy (good)

  3. 830b0d37... - has matched status but NO match record (orphaned)

  4. Root Cause: When Amy accepted the match for the first request, the backend updated BOTH request records to 'matched' status (because they have the same description or something went wrong during creation).

Let me check the getRequests endpoint to see how it's querying:

     1â†’import { Router, Request, Response } from 'express';
     2â†’import { query } from '../database/db';
     3â†’import { publishEvent } from '../events/publisher';
     4â†’
     5â†’const router = Router();
     6â†’
     7â†’// GET /requests - Get all requests (with filters)
     8â†’router.get('/', async (req: Request, res: Response) => {
     9â†’  try {
    10â†’    const { community_id, status = 'open', type, limit = 50, offset = 0 } = req.query;
    11â†’
    12â†’    let queryText = `
    13â†’      SELECT DISTINCT
    14â†’        r.id, r.requester_id, r.title, r.description,
    15â†’        r.category, r.urgency, r.status, r.created_at, r.updated_at,
    16â†’        u.name as requester_name,
    17â†’        STRING_AGG(DISTINCT c.name, ', ') as community_name,
    18â†’        STRING_AGG(DISTINCT rc.community_id::text, ',') as community_ids
    19â†’      FROM requests.help_requests r
    20â†’      LEFT JOIN auth.users u ON r.requester_id = u.id
    21â†’      LEFT JOIN requests.request_communities rc ON r.id = rc.request_id
    22â†’      LEFT JOIN communities.communities c ON rc.community_id = c.id
    23â†’      WHERE r.status = $1 AND r.expired = FALSE
    24â†’    `;
    25â†’
    26â†’    const params: any[] = [status];
    27â†’    let paramCount = 2;
    28â†’
    29â†’    if (community_id) {
    30â†’      queryText += ` AND rc.community_id = $${paramCount}`;
    31â†’      params.push(community_id);
    32â†’      paramCount++;
    33â†’    }
    34â†’
    35â†’    if (type) {
    36â†’      queryText += ` AND r.category = $${paramCount}`;
    37â†’      params.push(type);
    38â†’      paramCount++;
    39â†’    }
    40â†’
    41â†’    queryText += `
    42â†’      GROUP BY r.id, r.requester_id, r.title, r.description, r.category, r.urgency, r.status, r.created_at, r.updated_at, u.name
    43â†’      ORDER BY r.created_at DESC
    44â†’      LIMIT $${paramCount} OFFSET $${paramCount + 1}`;
    45â†’    params.push(limit, offset);
    46â†’
    47â†’    const result = await query(queryText, params);
    48â†’
    49â†’    res.json({
    50â†’      success: true,
    51â†’      data: result.rows,
    52â†’      count: result.rowCount,
    53â†’    });
    54â†’  } catch (error: any) {
    55â†’    console.error('Error fetching requests:', error);
    56â†’    res.status(500).json({
    57â†’      success: false,
    58â†’      message: 'Failed to fetch requests',
    59â†’      error: error.message,
    60â†’    });
    61â†’  }
    62â†’});
    63â†’
    64â†’// GET /requests/matched/for-user - Get requests matching user's skills
    65â†’router.get('/matched/for-user', async (req: Request, res: Response) => {
    66â†’  try {
    67â†’    const { user_id, limit = 10 } = req.query;
    68â†’
    69â†’    if (!user_id) {
    70â†’      return res.status(400).json({
    71â†’        success: false,
    72â†’        message: 'user_id is required',
    73â†’      });
    74â†’    }
    75â†’
    76â†’    // Get requests from user's communities that match their skills
    77â†’    // Skills match is based on category mapping to skills
    78â†’    const result = await query(
    79â†’      `SELECT DISTINCT
    80â†’        r.id, r.community_id, r.requester_id, r.title, r.description,
    81â†’        r.category, r.urgency, r.status, r.created_at, r.updated_at,
    82â†’        u.name as requester_name,
    83â†’        c.name as community_name,
    84â†’        CASE
    85â†’          WHEN r.urgency = 'high' THEN 3
    86â†’          WHEN r.urgency = 'medium' THEN 2
    87â†’          ELSE 1
    88â†’        END as urgency_priority
    89â†’      FROM requests.help_requests r
    90â†’      LEFT JOIN auth.users u ON r.requester_id = u.id
    91â†’      LEFT JOIN communities.communities c ON r.community_id = c.id
    92â†’      -- Only from communities the user is a member of
    93â†’      INNER JOIN communities.members m ON r.community_id = m.community_id
    94â†’      WHERE r.status = 'open'
    95â†’        AND r.expired = FALSE
    96â†’        AND m.user_id = $1
    97â†’        AND m.status = 'active'
    98â†’        AND r.requester_id != $1
    99â†’        AND EXISTS (
   100â†’          -- Match request category to user skills

I see the issue now! The query at line 8-62 is filtering by status (e.g., status = 'open'), but the dashboard is calling it with limit: 50 without filtering by requester_id. Let me check what the dashboard is actually doing:

Looking back at dashboard.tsx:75-79:

const [myRequestsRes, allMatchesRes, suggestedRes, communitiesRes] = await Promise.all([
  requestService.getRequests({ limit: 50 }),  // â† This gets ALL requests, not filtered!
  requestService.getMatches({ limit: 100 }),
  requestService.getRequests({ status: 'open', limit: 50 }),
  communityService.getCommunities(),
])

The problem is that getRequests({ limit: 50 }) gets ALL requests (status defaults to 'open'), not just the current user's requests. Then the dashboard filters them client-side.

But the REAL problem is the duplicate request records in the database. Let me check why Deborah has two identical requests:

Assistant2025-11-29T21:57:47.715Z

Perfect! Now I understand the issues completely:

Issue 1 - Duplicate Requests: - Request f700e224... is linked to TWO communities (Greater Dallas Mental Health + TX Business Connect) - Request 830b0d37... is linked to ONE community (TX Business Connect) - The dashboard query returns each request separately, creating visual duplicates for Amy

Issue 2 - Orphaned Matched Status: - Request 830b0d37... has status 'matched' but NO match record - This likely happened during test data generation or a bug

Issue 3 - Dashboard Query Problem: - The getRequests() call should be filtered by the current user to get "my requests" - Currently it's getting ALL open requests

   102â†’      localStorage.removeItem('user')

Assistant2025-11-29T22:26:11.766Z

Let me add the requester_id parameter to the backend endpoint:

âœï¸ Edit c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\services\request-service\src\routes\requests.ts
c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\services\request-service\src\routes\requests.ts

router.get('/', async (req: Request, res: Response) => {
  try {
    const { community_id, status = 'open', type, limit = 50, offset = 0 } = req.query;

    let queryText = `
      SELECT DISTINCT
        r.id, r.requester_id, r.title, r.description,
        r.category, r.urgency, r.status, r.created_at, r.updated_at,
        u.name as requester_name,
        STRING_AGG(DISTINCT c.name, ', ') as community_name,
        STRING_AGG(DISTINCT rc.community_id::text, ',') as community_ids
      FROM requests.help_requests r
      LEFT JOIN auth.users u ON r.requester_id = u.id
      LEFT JOIN requests.request_communities rc ON r.id = rc.request_id
      LEFT JOIN communities.communities c ON rc.community_id = c.id
      WHERE r.status = $1 AND r.expired = FALSE
    `;

    const params: any[] = [status];
    let paramCount = 2;

    if (community_id) {
      queryText += ` AND rc.community_id = $${paramCount}`;
      params.push(community_id);
      paramCount++;
    }

    if (type) {
      queryText += ` AND r.category = $${paramCount}`;
      params.push(type);
      paramCount++;
    }
+
router.get('/', async (req: Request, res: Response) => {
  try {
    const { community_id, status = 'open', type, requester_id, limit = 50, offset = 0 } = req.query;

    let queryText = `
      SELECT DISTINCT
        r.id, r.requester_id, r.title, r.description,
        r.category, r.urgency, r.status, r.created_at, r.updated_at,
        u.name as requester_name,
        STRING_AGG(DISTINCT c.name, ', ') as community_name,
        STRING_AGG(DISTINCT rc.community_id::text, ',') as community_ids
      FROM requests.help_requests r
      LEFT JOIN auth.users u ON r.requester_id = u.id
      LEFT JOIN requests.request_communities rc ON r.id = rc.request_id
      LEFT JOIN communities.communities c ON rc.community_id = c.id
      WHERE r.status = $1 AND r.expired = FALSE
    `;

    const params: any[] = [status];
    let paramCount = 2;

    if (community_id) {
      queryText += ` AND rc.community_id = $${paramCount}`;
      params.push(community_id);
      paramCount++;
    }

    if (requester_id) {
      queryText += ` AND r.requester_id = $${paramCount}`;
      params.push(requester_id);
      paramCount++;
    }

    if (type) {
      queryText += ` AND r.category = $${paramCount}`;
      params.push(type);
      paramCount++;
    }

    22â†’      LEFT JOIN communities.communities c ON rc.community_id = c.id

    48â†’      GROUP BY r.id, r.requester_id, r.title, r.description, r.category, r.urgency, r.status, r.created_at, r.updated_at, u.name
    49â†’      ORDER BY r.created_at DESC

Assistant2025-11-29T22:26:45.136Z
âœï¸ Edit c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\services\request-service\src\routes\requests.ts

âˆ’
router.get('/', async (req: Request, res: Response) => {
  try {
    const { community_id, status = 'open', type, requester_id, limit = 50, offset = 0 } = req.query;

    let queryText = `
      SELECT DISTINCT
        r.id, r.requester_id, r.title, r.description,
        r.category, r.urgency, r.status, r.created_at, r.updated_at,
        u.name as requester_name,
        STRING_AGG(DISTINCT c.name, ', ') as community_name,
        STRING_AGG(DISTINCT rc.community_id::text, ',') as community_ids
      FROM requests.help_requests r
      LEFT JOIN auth.users u ON r.requester_id = u.id
      LEFT JOIN requests.request_communities rc ON r.id = rc.request_id
      LEFT JOIN communities.communities c ON rc.community_id = c.id
      WHERE r.status = $1 AND r.expired = FALSE
    `;

    const params: any[] = [status];
    let paramCount = 2;
+
router.get('/', async (req: Request, res: Response) => {
  try {
    const { community_id, status, type, requester_id, limit = 50, offset = 0 } = req.query;

    let queryText = `
      SELECT DISTINCT
        r.id, r.requester_id, r.title, r.description,
        r.category, r.urgency, r.status, r.created_at, r.updated_at,
        u.name as requester_name,
        STRING_AGG(DISTINCT c.name, ', ') as community_name,
        STRING_AGG(DISTINCT rc.community_id::text, ',') as community_ids
      FROM requests.help_requests r
      LEFT JOIN auth.users u ON r.requester_id = u.id
      LEFT JOIN requests.request_communities rc ON r.id = rc.request_id
      LEFT JOIN communities.communities c ON rc.community_id = c.id
      WHERE r.expired = FALSE

Now I need to add the status filter back in conditionally:

Assistant2025-11-29T22:27:01.424Z
âœï¸ Edit c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\services\request-service\src\routes\requests.ts
c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\services\request-service\src\routes\requests.ts
âˆ’
    const params: any[] = [];
    let paramCount = 1;

    if (community_id) {
      queryText += ` AND rc.community_id = $${paramCount}`;
      params.push(community_id);
      paramCount++;
    }

    if (requester_id) {
      queryText += ` AND r.requester_id = $${paramCount}`;
      params.push(requester_id);
      paramCount++;
    }

    if (type) {
      queryText += ` AND r.category = $${paramCount}`;
      params.push(type);
      paramCount++;
    }
+
    const params: any[] = [];
    let paramCount = 1;

    if (status) {
      queryText += ` AND r.status = $${paramCount}`;
      params.push(status);
      paramCount++;
    }

    if (community_id) {
      queryText += ` AND rc.community_id = $${paramCount}`;
      params.push(community_id);
      paramCount++;
    }

    if (requester_id) {
      queryText += ` AND r.requester_id = $${paramCount}`;
      params.push(requester_id);
      paramCount++;
    }

    if (type) {
      queryText += ` AND r.category = $${paramCount}`;
      params.push(type);
      paramCount++;
    }

  const fetchDashboardData = async (userId: string) => {
    try {
      setLoading(true)

      // Fetch all data in parallel
      const [myRequestsRes, allMatchesRes, suggestedRes, communitiesRes] = await Promise.all([
        requestService.getRequests({ limit: 50 }),
        requestService.getMatches({ limit: 100 }),
        requestService.getRequests({ status: 'open', limit: 50 }),
        communityService.getCommunities(),
      ])

      const allRequests = myRequestsRes.data.data
      const allMatches = allMatchesRes.data.data
      const suggestedRequests = suggestedRes.data.data

  const fetchDashboardData = async (userId: string) => {
    try {
      setLoading(true)

      // Fetch all data in parallel
      const [myRequestsRes, allMatchesRes, suggestedRes, communitiesRes] = await Promise.all([
        requestService.getRequests({ requester_id: userId, limit: 50 }), // Get MY requests (all statuses)
        requestService.getMatches({ limit: 100 }),
        requestService.getRequests({ status: 'open', limit: 50 }), // Get community requests (open only)
        communityService.getCommunities(),
      ])

      const allMatches = allMatchesRes.data.data
      const suggestedRequests = suggestedRes.data.data

  code: 'ERR_ERL_KEY_GEN_IPV6',

Assistant2025-11-29T22:28:38.534Z

Perfect! Now let me create a summary of what was fixed:

Summary

I've fixed both issues you reported:

Issue 1: Duplicate Requests in Amy's Dashboard âœ…

Root Cause: - The dashboard was fetching ALL requests instead of filtering by the current user - Deborah had one request linked to 2 communities, plus a duplicate orphaned request - This caused duplicates to appear in the feed

Fixes Applied: 1. Added requester_id parameter support to the backend /requests endpoint (requests.ts:35-44) 2. Made status parameter optional to allow fetching requests in all statuses (requests.ts:29-33) 3. Updated frontend API client to accept requester_id parameter (api.ts:231) 4. Updated dashboard to fetch "my requests" using requester_id: userId (dashboard.tsx:76) 5. Deleted the orphaned duplicate request from the database

Issue 2: Missing Accepted Request in Deborah's Dashboard âœ…

Root Cause: - Same issue - dashboard wasn't properly fetching Deborah's requests - The orphaned duplicate request had 'matched' status but no actual match record

Fix: - By filtering requests by requester_id, Deborah's dashboard now correctly shows only her actual request with the accepted match from Amy

Database Cleanup âœ…

  • Removed the orphaned request (830b0d37...) that had no match record
  • Deborah now has exactly 1 request (with 2 community links and 1 accepted match from Amy)

Test the Fixes

Please refresh both dashboards: - Deborah's dashboard: Should show 1 request with Amy's accepted offer - Amy's dashboard: Should show no duplicates and should display the accepted request in the "YOU'RE HELPING" section

The services have been restarted with the fixes deployed.

Assistant2025-11-29T22:26:11.766Z
âœï¸ Edit c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\services\request-service\src\routes\requests.ts
c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\services\request-service\src\routes\requests.ts
âˆ’
router.get('/', async (req: Request, res: Response) => {
  try {
    const { community_id, status = 'open', type, limit = 50, offset = 0 } = req.query;

    let queryText = `
      SELECT DISTINCT
        r.id, r.requester_id, r.title, r.description,
        r.category, r.urgency, r.status, r.created_at, r.updated_at,
        u.name as requester_name,
        STRING_AGG(DISTINCT c.name, ', ') as community_name,
        STRING_AGG(DISTINCT rc.community_id::text, ',') as community_ids
      FROM requests.help_requests r
      LEFT JOIN auth.users u ON r.requester_id = u.id
      LEFT JOIN requests.request_communities rc ON r.id = rc.request_id
      LEFT JOIN communities.communities c ON rc.community_id = c.id
      WHERE r.status = $1 AND r.expired = FALSE
    `;

    const params: any[] = [status];
    let paramCount = 2;

    if (community_id) {
      queryText += ` AND rc.community_id = $${paramCount}`;
      params.push(community_id);
      paramCount++;
    }

    if (type) {
      queryText += ` AND r.category = $${paramCount}`;
      params.push(type);
      paramCount++;
    }
+
router.get('/', async (req: Request, res: Response) => {
  try {
    const { community_id, status = 'open', type, requester_id, limit = 50, offset = 0 } = req.query;

    let queryText = `
      SELECT DISTINCT
        r.id, r.requester_id, r.title, r.description,
        r.category, r.urgency, r.status, r.created_at, r.updated_at,
        u.name as requester_name,
        STRING_AGG(DISTINCT c.name, ', ') as community_name,
        STRING_AGG(DISTINCT rc.community_id::text, ',') as community_ids
      FROM requests.help_requests r
      LEFT JOIN auth.users u ON r.requester_id = u.id
      LEFT JOIN requests.request_communities rc ON r.id = rc.request_id
      LEFT JOIN communities.communities c ON rc.community_id = c.id
      WHERE r.status = $1 AND r.expired = FALSE
    `;

    const params: any[] = [status];
    let paramCount = 2;

    if (community_id) {
      queryText += ` AND rc.community_id = $${paramCount}`;
      params.push(community_id);
      paramCount++;
    }

    if (requester_id) {
      queryText += ` AND r.requester_id = $${paramCount}`;
      params.push(requester_id);
      paramCount++;
    }

    if (type) {
      queryText += ` AND r.category = $${paramCount}`;
      params.push(type);
      paramCount++;
    }

  const fetchDashboardData = async (userId: string) => {
    try {
      setLoading(true)

      // Fetch all data in parallel
      const [myRequestsRes, allMatchesRes, suggestedRes, communitiesRes] = await Promise.all([
        requestService.getRequests({ limit: 50 }),
        requestService.getMatches({ limit: 100 }),
        requestService.getRequests({ status: 'open', limit: 50 }),
        communityService.getCommunities(),
      ])

      const allRequests = myRequestsRes.data.data
      const allMatches = allMatchesRes.data.data
      const suggestedRequests = suggestedRes.data.data
+
  const fetchDashboardData = async (userId: string) => {
    try {
      setLoading(true)

      // Fetch all data in parallel
      const [myRequestsRes, allMatchesRes, suggestedRes, communitiesRes] = await Promise.all([
        requestService.getRequests({ requester_id: userId, limit: 50 }), // Get MY requests (all statuses)
        requestService.getMatches({ limit: 100 }),
        requestService.getRequests({ status: 'open', limit: 50 }), // Get community requests (open only)
        communityService.getCommunities(),
      ])

      const allRequests = myRequestsRes.data.data
      const allMatches = allMatchesRes.data.data
      const suggestedRequests = suggestedRes.data.data

Assistant2025-11-29T22:28:38.534Z

Perfect! Now let me create a summary of what was fixed:

Summary

I've fixed both issues you reported:

Issue 1: Duplicate Requests in Amy's Dashboard âœ…

Root Cause: - The dashboard was fetching ALL requests instead of filtering by the current user - Deborah had one request linked to 2 communities, plus a duplicate orphaned request - This caused duplicates to appear in the feed

Fixes Applied: 1. Added requester_id parameter support to the backend /requests endpoint (requests.ts:35-44) 2. Made status parameter optional to allow fetching requests in all statuses (requests.ts:29-33) 3. Updated frontend API client to accept requester_id parameter (api.ts:231) 4. Updated dashboard to fetch "my requests" using requester_id: userId (dashboard.tsx:76) 5. Deleted the orphaned duplicate request from the database

Issue 2: Missing Accepted Request in Deborah's Dashboard âœ…

Root Cause: - Same issue - dashboard wasn't properly fetching Deborah's requests - The orphaned duplicate request had 'matched' status but no actual match record

Fix: - By filtering requests by requester_id, Deborah's dashboard now correctly shows only her actual request with the accepted match from Amy

Database Cleanup âœ…

  • Removed the orphaned request (830b0d37...) that had no match record
  • Deborah now has exactly 1 request (with 2 community links and 1 accepted match from Amy)

Test the Fixes

Please refresh both dashboards: - Deborah's dashboard: Should show 1 request with Amy's accepted offer - Amy's dashboard: Should show no duplicates and should display the accepted request in the "YOU'RE HELPING" section

The services have been restarted with the fixes deployed.

   118â†’        (m: Match) => m.responder_id === userId && m.status === 'matched'

Assistant2025-11-29T23:14:41.942Z


I see the issue! At line 123, the code filters allRequestsCombined to find requests. But allRequestsCombined is built from:
- allRequests - which now only contains Amy's own requests (due to my fix with requester_id: userId)
- suggestedRequests - which only contains open requests


Since Deborah's request is now matched (not open), it won't be in suggestedRequests, and since it's not Amy's request, it won't be in allRequests. So the request is missing from the lookup!


Let me trace through the logic:


    

  1. Line 76: allRequests = requests where requester_id = Amy â†’ Empty (Amy hasn't created requests)
    2. 

  2. Line 78: suggestedRequests = requests where status = 'open' â†’ Won't include Deborah's matched request
    3. 

  3. Line 87: allRequestsCombined = Amy's requests + open requests â†’ Missing Deborah's matched request!
    4. 

  4. Line 123: Tries to find Deborah's request in allRequestsCombined â†’ Not found!
    5. 



The fix is to also fetch matched requests that Amy is helping with. Let me update the dashboard:


Assistant2025-11-29T23:14:49.351Z


âœï¸ Edit c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\frontend\src\pages\dashboard.tsx


c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\frontend\src\pages\dashboard.tsx




âˆ’
      // Fetch all data in parallel
      const [myRequestsRes, allMatchesRes, suggestedRes, communitiesRes] = await Promise.all([
        requestService.getRequests({ requester_id: userId, limit: 50 }), // Get MY requests (all statuses)
        requestService.getMatches({ limit: 100 }),
        requestService.getRequests({ status: 'open', limit: 50 }), // Get community requests (open only)
        communityService.getCommunities(),
      ])

      const allRequests = myRequestsRes.data.data
      const allMatches = allMatchesRes.data.data
      const suggestedRequests = suggestedRes.data.data

      // Combine all requests (my requests + community requests) for lookup
      const allRequestsCombined = [...allRequests, ...suggestedRequests]


+
      // Fetch all data in parallel
      const [myRequestsRes, allMatchesRes, suggestedRes, matchedRequestsRes, communitiesRes] = await Promise.all([
        requestService.getRequests({ requester_id: userId, limit: 50 }), // Get MY requests (all statuses)
        requestService.getMatches({ limit: 100 }),
        requestService.getRequests({ status: 'open', limit: 50 }), // Get community requests (open only)
        requestService.getRequests({ status: 'matched', limit: 50 }), // Get matched requests (for offers I'm helping with)
        communityService.getCommunities(),
      ])

      const allRequests = myRequestsRes.data.data
      const allMatches = allMatchesRes.data.data
      const suggestedRequests = suggestedRes.data.data
      const matchedRequests = matchedRequestsRes.data.data

      // Combine all requests (my requests + open requests + matched requests) for lookup
      const allRequestsCombined = [...allRequests, ...suggestedRequests, ...matchedRequests]

Assistant2025-11-29T23:15:34.877Z


Perfect! The frontend has restarted successfully. Now let me verify the fix is working by checking what would happen when Amy logs in:


Summary of Fix


I found and fixed the issue! Here's what was wrong:


Root Cause


The dashboard was only fetching:
1. My Requests (requester_id = Amy) â†’ Empty, Amy hasn't created requests
2. Open Requests (status = 'open') â†’ Doesn't include Deborah's request because it's now 'matched'


When Amy accepted Deborah's request, the request status changed from 'open' to 'matched', so it disappeared from the "open requests" query. But Amy's accepted offers (Priority 2, lines 116-141) needed to look up the matched requests, and they weren't in the allRequestsCombined array!


The Fix


I added a third query to fetch matched requests (dashboard.tsx:79) so that accepted offers can properly display the request details.


Before:


const allRequestsCombined = [...allRequests, ...suggestedRequests]
// Missing matched requests!



After:


const allRequestsCombined = [...allRequests, ...suggestedRequests, ...matchedRequests]
// Now includes matched requests for accepted offers



What Should Now Work


When Amy refreshes her dashboard, she should see:
- "âœ“ YOU'RE HELPING" section with Deborah's request (and Melissa's request)
- Both requests should display in blue highlighting
- The inline chat should be available for both
- No more duplicates


Please refresh Amy's dashboard (http://localhost:3000/dashboard) and verify that:
1. Deborah's accepted request appears in the "YOU'RE HELPING" section
2. No duplicate requests appear
3. The inline chat is available


The frontend has been restarted with the fix deployed!

Tool reply2025-11-29T23:38:41.133Z
     1â†’import { useState, useEffect, useRef } from 'react'
     2â†’import { messagingService } from '@/lib/api'
     3â†’import { useMessaging } from '@/hooks/useMessaging'
     4â†’
     5â†’interface InlineChatProps {
     6â†’  matchId: string
     7â†’  currentUserId: string
     8â†’  isRequester: boolean
     9â†’  matchStatus: 'proposed' | 'matched' | 'rejected'
    10â†’  otherParticipantName: string
    11â†’}
    12â†’
    13â†’export default function InlineChat({
    14â†’  matchId,
    15â†’  currentUserId,
    16â†’  otherParticipantName,
    17â†’}: InlineChatProps) {
    18â†’  const [newMessage, setNewMessage] = useState('')
    19â†’  const [sending, setSending] = useState(false)
    20â†’  const [isExpanded, setIsExpanded] = useState(false)
    21â†’  const [conversationId, setConversationId] = useState<string | null>(null)
    22â†’  const messagesEndRef = useRef<HTMLDivElement>(null)
    23â†’  const inputRef = useRef<HTMLInputElement>(null)
    24â†’  const typingTimeoutRef = useRef<NodeJS.Timeout | null>(null)
    25â†’
    26â†’  // Use the WebSocket messaging hook
    27â†’  const {
    28â†’    messages,
    29â†’    loading,
    30â†’    connected,
    31â†’    sendMessage: sendMessageWS,
    32â†’    refreshMessages,
    33â†’    startTyping,
    34â†’    stopTyping,
    35â†’    isTyping,
    36â†’    typingUser,
    37â†’  } = useMessaging({
    38â†’    matchId,
    39â†’    conversationId,
    40â†’    enabled: isExpanded, // Only connect when expanded
    41â†’  })
    42â†’
    43â†’  // Fetch conversation ID and initial messages when expanded
    44â†’  useEffect(() => {
    45â†’    if (isExpanded && !conversationId) {
    46â†’      fetchConversation()
    47â†’    }
    48â†’  }, [isExpanded, matchId])
    49â†’
    50â†’  // Auto-scroll when new messages arrive
    51â†’  useEffect(() => {
    52â†’    if (messages.length > 0) {
    53â†’      scrollToBottom()
    54â†’    }
    55â†’  }, [messages])
    56â†’
    57â†’  const fetchConversation = async () => {
    58â†’    try {
    59â†’      const response = await messagingService.getMatchConversation(matchId)
    60â†’      setConversationId(response.data.conversation_id)
    61â†’      // Messages will be loaded by the hook after conversationId is set
    62â†’    } catch (error) {
    63â†’      console.error('Error fetching conversation:', error)
    64â†’    }
    65â†’  }
    66â†’
    67â†’  // Refresh messages when conversationId is available
    68â†’  useEffect(() => {
    69â†’    if (conversationId && isExpanded) {
    70â†’      refreshMessages()
    71â†’    }
    72â†’  }, [conversationId, isExpanded, refreshMessages])
    73â†’
    74â†’  const handleSendMessage = async (e: React.FormEvent) => {
    75â†’    e.preventDefault()
    76â†’    if (!newMessage.trim() || sending) return
    77â†’
    78â†’    try {
    79â†’      setSending(true)
    80â†’      stopTyping() // Stop typing indicator before sending
    81â†’
    82â†’      await sendMessageWS(newMessage.trim())
    83â†’      setNewMessage('')
    84â†’
    85â†’      // Scroll to bottom after sending
    86â†’      setTimeout(() => scrollToBottom(), 100)
    87â†’    } catch (error: any) {
    88â†’      console.error('Error sending message:', error)
    89â†’      alert(error.message || 'Failed to send message')
    90â†’    } finally {
    91â†’      setSending(false)
    92â†’    }
    93â†’  }
    94â†’
    95â†’  const handleTyping = (value: string) => {
    96â†’    setNewMessage(value)
    97â†’
    98â†’    // Start typing indicator
    99â†’    if (value.trim()) {
   100â†’      startTyping()
   101â†’
   102â†’      // Clear existing timeout
   103â†’      if (typingTimeoutRef.current) {
   104â†’        clearTimeout(typingTimeoutRef.current)
   105â†’      }
   106â†’
   107â†’      // Stop typing indicator after 1 second of inactivity
   108â†’      typingTimeoutRef.current = setTimeout(() => {
   109â†’        stopTyping()
   110â†’      }, 1000)
   111â†’    } else {
   112â†’      stopTyping()
   113â†’    }
   114â†’  }
   115â†’
   116â†’  const scrollToBottom = () => {
   117â†’    messagesEndRef.current?.scrollIntoView({ behavior: 'smooth' })
   118â†’  }
   119â†’
   120â†’  const formatTime = (timestamp: string) => {
   121â†’    const date = new Date(timestamp)
   122â†’    const now = new Date()
   123â†’    const diffMs = now.getTime() - date.getTime()
   124â†’    const diffMins = Math.floor(diffMs / 60000)
   125â†’    const diffHours = Math.floor(diffMs / 3600000)
   126â†’
   127â†’    if (diffMins < 1) return 'just now'
   128â†’    if (diffMins < 60) return `${diffMins}m ago`
   129â†’    if (diffHours < 24) return `${diffHours}h ago`
   130â†’    return date.toLocaleTimeString('en-US', { hour: 'numeric', minute: '2-digit' })
   131â†’  }
   132â†’
   133â†’  const messageCount = messages.length
   134â†’
   135â†’  return (
   136â†’    <div className="mt-4 border-t border-gray-200 pt-4">
   137â†’      {/* Header - Toggle */}
   138â†’      <button
   139â†’        onClick={() => setIsExpanded(!isExpanded)}
   140â†’        className="flex items-center justify-between w-full text-left hover:bg-gray-50 rounded-lg px-3 py-2 transition-colors"
   141â†’      >
   142â†’        <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
   143â†’          <svg className="w-5 h-5 text-gray-600" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24">
   144â†’            <path
   145â†’              strokeLinecap="round"
   146â†’              strokeLinejoin="round"
   147â†’              strokeWidth={2}
   148â†’              d="M8 12h.01M12 12h.01M16 12h.01M21 12c0 4.418-4.03 8-9 8a9.863 9.863 0 01-4.255-.949L3 20l1.395-3.72C3.512 15.042 3 13.574 3 12c0-4.418 4.03-8 9-8s9 3.582 9 8z"
   149â†’            />
   150â†’          </svg>
   151â†’          <span className="text-sm font-medium text-gray-700">
   152â†’            Chat with {otherParticipantName}
   153â†’          </span>
   154â†’          {messageCount > 0 && (
   155â†’            <span className="text-xs text-gray-500">({messageCount} message{messageCount !== 1 ? 's' : ''})</span>
   156â†’          )}
   157â†’          {connected && isExpanded && (
   158â†’            <span className="flex items-center gap-1 text-xs text-green-600">
   159â†’              <div className="w-2 h-2 bg-green-500 rounded-full"></div>
   160â†’              Live
   161â†’            </span>
   162â†’          )}
   163â†’        </div>
   164â†’        <svg
   165â†’          className={`w-5 h-5 text-gray-400 transition-transform ${isExpanded ? 'rotate-180' : ''}`}
   166â†’          fill="none"
   167â†’          stroke="currentColor"
   168â†’          viewBox="0 0 24 24"
   169â†’        >
   170â†’          <path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" strokeWidth={2} d="M19 9l-7 7-7-7" />
   171â†’        </svg>
   172â†’      </button>
   173â†’
   174â†’      {/* Messages - Expandable */}
   175â†’      {isExpanded && (
   176â†’        <div className="mt-3 bg-gray-50 rounded-lg border border-gray-200 overflow-hidden">
   177â†’          {/* Messages List */}
   178â†’          <div className="max-h-80 overflow-y-auto p-4 space-y-3">
   179â†’            {loading ? (
   180â†’              <div className="text-center py-8">
   181â†’                <div className="animate-spin rounded-full h-8 w-8 border-b-2 border-blue-600 mx-auto"></div>
   182â†’                <p className="text-sm text-gray-500 mt-2">Loading messages...</p>
   183â†’              </div>
   184â†’            ) : messages.length === 0 ? (
   185â†’              <div className="text-center py-8">
   186â†’                <svg className="w-12 h-12 text-gray-300 mx-auto mb-2" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24">
   187â†’                  <path
   188â†’                    strokeLinecap="round"
   189â†’                    strokeLinejoin="round"
   190â†’                    strokeWidth={2}
   191â†’                    d="M8 12h.01M12 12h.01M16 12h.01M21 12c0 4.418-4.03 8-9 8a9.863 9.863 0 01-4.255-.949L3 20l1.395-3.72C3.512 15.042 3 13.574 3 12c0-4.418 4.03-8 9-8s9 3.582 9 8z"
   192â†’                  />
   193â†’                </svg>
   194â†’                <p className="text-sm text-gray-500">No messages yet</p>
   195â†’                <p className="text-xs text-gray-400 mt-1">Start the conversation!</p>
   196â†’              </div>
   197â†’            ) : (
   198â†’              <>
   199â†’                {messages.map((message) => {
   200â†’                  const isSender = message.sender_id === currentUserId
   201â†’                  return (
   202â†’                    <div key={message.id} className={`flex ${isSender ? 'justify-end' : 'justify-start'}`}>
   203â†’                      <div className={`max-w-xs ${isSender ? 'order-2' : 'order-1'}`}>
   204â†’                        <div
   205â†’                          className={`rounded-lg px-4 py-2 ${
   206â†’                            isSender
   207â†’                              ? 'bg-blue-600 text-white'
   208â†’                              : 'bg-white text-gray-900 border border-gray-200'
   209â†’                          }`}
   210â†’                        >
   211â†’                          <p className="text-sm leading-relaxed">{message.content}</p>
   212â†’                        </div>
   213â†’                        <p className={`text-xs text-gray-500 mt-1 ${isSender ? 'text-right' : 'text-left'}`}>
   214â†’                          {formatTime(message.created_at)}
   215â†’                        </p>
   216â†’                      </div>
   217â†’                    </div>
   218â†’                  )
   219â†’                })}
   220â†’                <div ref={messagesEndRef} />
   221â†’              </>
   222â†’            )}
   223â†’
   224â†’            {/* Typing Indicator */}
   225â†’            {isTyping && typingUser && (
   226â†’              <div className="flex justify-start">
   227â†’                <div className="bg-gray-200 rounded-lg px-4 py-2">
   228â†’                  <div className="flex items-center gap-1">
   229â†’                    <div className="flex gap-1">
   230â†’                      <div className="w-2 h-2 bg-gray-500 rounded-full animate-bounce" style={{ animationDelay: '0ms' }}></div>
   231â†’                      <div className="w-2 h-2 bg-gray-500 rounded-full animate-bounce" style={{ animationDelay: '150ms' }}></div>
   232â†’                      <div className="w-2 h-2 bg-gray-500 rounded-full animate-bounce" style={{ animationDelay: '300ms' }}></div>
   233â†’                    </div>
   234â†’                    <span className="text-xs text-gray-600 ml-2">{typingUser} is typing...</span>
   235â†’                  </div>
   236â†’                </div>
   237â†’              </div>
   238â†’            )}
   239â†’          </div>
   240â†’
   241â†’          {/* Message Input */}
   242â†’          <form onSubmit={handleSendMessage} className="border-t border-gray-200 p-3 bg-white">
   243â†’            <div className="flex gap-2">
   244â†’              <input
   245â†’                ref={inputRef}
   246â†’                type="text"
   247â†’                value={newMessage}
   248â†’                onChange={(e) => handleTyping(e.target.value)}
   249â†’                placeholder="Type your message..."
   250â†’                className="flex-1 px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 focus:border-transparent text-sm"
   251â†’                disabled={sending}
   252â†’              />
   253â†’              <button
   254â†’                type="submit"
   255â†’                disabled={!newMessage.trim() || sending}
   256â†’                className="px-4 py-2 bg-blue-600 text-white rounded-lg hover:bg-blue-700 disabled:opacity-50 disabled:cursor-not-allowed transition-colors text-sm font-medium"
   257â†’              >
   258â†’                {sending ? 'Sending...' : 'Send'}
   259â†’              </button>
   260â†’            </div>
   261â†’          </form>
   262â†’        </div>
   263â†’      )}
   264â†’    </div>
   265â†’  )
   266â†’}
   267â†’

Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>



Assistant2025-11-29T23:38:44.786Z


I see the issue - the loading state (line 179-183) is controlled by the loading variable from the useMessaging hook. Let me check that hook:
